page.title: 03Farming in Kimblesworth
page.content: A typical farm in the area is run by Mr Robert Hall. He farms 432 acres ( Winter Wheat 100, Winter Barley 75, Spring Barley 30, Oil Seed Rape 30, Forage Rape 20, Potatoes 14, Peas 12, Oats 10 and Turnips 10). Mr Hall employs only 3 farm workers because of the growth of technology. Nowadays farm workers have to be able to handle modern equipment, animals and be craftsmen. The biggest change in farming has been the reduction of cattle (Dairy and Stock - only 22 on this farm) due to low profitability. Mr Hall does have 300 breeding ewes. The lambs being fattened and sold when they are 3-6 months old.
